newsitem.title: UK: LABOUR 2-5 ON TO WIN NEXT UK ELECTION.
newsitem.headline: LABOUR 2-5 ON TO WIN NEXT UK ELECTION.

text.p: Britain's ruling Labour Party are odds-on favourites to win the next election even though it is not expected to be held for at least four years, bookmakers William Hill said on Friday.
On the day that the government celebrated its first 100 days in office, William Hill quoted odds of 2-5 on Labour to have the largest number of seats in the House of Commons after the next election.
They offered the opposition Conservatives at 7-4 and the minority Liberal Democrats at 50-1.
Labour won an overall majority of 179 seats at the May 1 election and does not have to call another poll until the spring of 2002.
